newsitem.title: JAPAN: PRESS DIGEST - Top Japan business news - Sept 30.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Top Japan business news - Sept 30.

text.p: Sega Enterprises Ltd plans to set up a joint venture to sell arcade video game machines in Australia, in cooperation with Village Nine Network Leisure of Australia. The new company will be capitalised at between 600 and 700 million yen, with each firm holding a 50-percent stake. Sega hopes for sales of 1.5 billion yen in Australia and New Zealand in the first year.

Mitsui & Co Ltd plans to set up a steel plate processing subsidiary in Yokohama with a monthly processing capacity of 30,000 tonnes. The new company, capitalised at 536 million yen, will be owned 63.2 percent by Mitsui, 21 percent by Nippon Steel Corp and 14 percent by Takasago Tekko KK.
